title: Create link to connection instead of duplicating?
author: changbowen
body_snippet:
This is only a feature suggestion.
From time to time, when I have a lot of connections and folders created, I want to have some kind of shortcut, or something similar to a symbolic link created pointing to another connection. Currently I have a "_Quick" folder and a bunch of duplicated connections. It works fine but when I need to update the connection configurations, I have to update both the original one and the duplicated one. It would be nice if I can create a link to a connection.
Thanks!

iterations.description: This is a clear quality-of-life feature request that can reduce duplicate entries and ongoing config maintenance.
This is a clear user-facing enhancement with maintainer-positive feedback and can be built on top of the existing duplicate-node workflow.
Feature request to support connection aliases/links instead of full duplication, reducing sync issues when the same connection appears in multiple folders
Feature is already implemented in the codebase (ConnectionInfo, ConnectionTree, ContextMenu) and verified with tests.

notes:
AI triage (codex): This is a clear quality-of-life feature request that can reduce duplicate entries and ongoing config maintenance.
Approach: Introduce a linked-connection entry that stores a reference to a source connection and resolves shared settings at runtime instead of copying values.
AI triage (codex): This is a clear user-facing enhancement with maintainer-positive feedback and can be built on top of the existing duplicate-node workflow.
Approach: Add a new 'Create Link' action that stores a reference to an existing connection and reuses the target settings at runtime instead of deep-cloning properties.
AI triage (claude): Feature request to support connection aliases/links instead of full duplication, reducing sync issues when the same connection appears in multiple folders
Approach: Add a LinkTarget property to ConnectionInfo that references another connection's ID. When a connection is a link, it delegates all property reads to the target. Serializers save/load link references. Tree operations offer 'Create Link' alongside 'Duplicate'.
